x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: During natural disasters (floods, wildfires, earthquakes), survivors often struggle to find shelter, food, or medical help, while agencies struggle with poor coordination and visibility. Traditional systems rely on manual reporting, disconnected workflows, and slow response times. This delay leads to inefficient resource distribution, redundant efforts, and lives being put at risk.

x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

The solution is a centralized, ServiceNow-based Disaster Relief Management Platform:

  1. Self-Service Portal: Citizens can report their needs (e.g., food, shelter, first aid) through a mobile/web interface or SMS.
  2. AI Virtual Agent: Automatically triages incoming requests and provides immediate, location-based guidance (e.g., nearby open shelters).
  3. Case Management: Creates and routes cases to appropriate NGOs, medical teams, or local authorities.
  4. Live Situation Dashboard: Geo-mapped visualization of needs, request statuses, and available resources.
  5. Volunteer and Resource Management: Register, assign, and track volunteers, vehicles, and supplies.
  6. Multi-Agency Coordination: Share case data and workflows securely between government bodies, NGOs, and relief workers.

ServiceNow products or capabilities  -

  1. ServiceNow Virtual Agent + Generative AI Studio
  2. Case and Knowledge Management
  3. ServiceNow App Engine (for custom disaster workflows)
  4. IntegrationHub (for GIS, SMS gateways, and third-party responders)
  5. Mobile App & Offline Support
  6. Performance Analytics & Dashboards

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • Integration with mapping/GIS platforms (e.g., Google Maps, ArcGIS)
  • SMS gateway or mobile messaging APIs
  • Offline support for areas with no network
  • Secure data sharing with government and aid agency systems

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  • Providing offline access in low-connectivity disaster zones
  • Ensuring multilingual and accessible UI for diverse users
  • Managing spikes in traffic during emergencies
  • Building trust and adoption among multiple responding agencies
  • Ensuring compliance with data privacy and disaster response standards
